question.text: You are driving on a motorway and want to use your mobile phone. What should you do?

explanation.text: Except in a genuine emergency you MUST NOT use your mobile phone when driving. If you need to use it leave the motorway and find a safe place to stop. Even a hands-free phone can distract your attention. Use your voicemail to receive calls. Driving requires all of your attention, all of the time.

answer.text: Try to find a safe place on the hard shoulder
Leave the motorway and stop in a safe place
Use the next exit and pull up on the slip road
Move to the left lane and reduce your speed
